faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about our photobooths

items.question: How much space is needed and can it be installed outside?
items.answer: About 3×3 meters and an electrical outlet are needed. Outdoor installation is possible if the space is sheltered.

items.question: Is printing really unlimited?
items.answer: YES! Unlike our competitors who limit to 150-400 prints, at Happy Booth it's REALLY unlimited. Your guests can print as much as they want. The more photos, the more fun!

items.question: How do we get the digital photos?
items.answer: All photos are immediately available in a private online gallery accessible to all your guests. You will also receive all high-definition files after the event.

items.question: What if internet is weak or the photobooth breaks down?
items.answer:
Weak internet: No problem! Printing works offline, email sending will happen as soon as the network is available.

Breakdown (very rare): We always have backup equipment ready and a technician available 24/7. In case of breakdown, we replace the equipment within the hour or fully refund the service. No event has ever been ruined by a breakdown with us.

items.question: Will my elderly guests or children know how to use it?
items.answer: Absolutely! The interface is ultra-intuitive with clear icons and can be configured in 6 languages. Children from 5 years old use it without problem, and we can provide a stool for the smallest ones. Host option available to accompany your guests (45 CHF/hour).

items.question: Why not simply put an iPhone with a printer?
items.answer: A professional photobooth offers: studio quality (lighting, pro lens), interactive animations impossible on smartphone, high-quality instant prints, automatic queue management, complete customization, and above all real animation that creates the event. DIY requires someone dedicated all evening.

items.question: 800-1000 CHF for a few hours, isn't that excessive?
items.answer: Divided by 100 guests = 8-10 CHF per person for a personalized souvenir they will keep. Let's compare: a photographer costs 2000-4000 CHF, a DJ 1500 CHF. Our professional equipment costs over 15,000 CHF and requires maintenance, transport, customization (2h graphic preparation), installation (2h), and technical presence.

items.question: What if few people use it in the end?
items.answer: Never happened in 1000+ events! Average statistics: 80% of guests use it, 3-5 passes per person, 300-600 photos per event of 100 people. Strategic placement (near bar/dance floor) and our fun accessories guarantee success. "Satisfied or refunded" guarantee if less than 50 photos taken.

items.question: When to book?
items.answer: Ideally 2-4 months in advance for major dates, but we also accept last-minute bookings depending on availability.

items.question: Why pay more than a low-cost provider's offer?
items.answer:
Budget offers often require you to manage yourself: equipment pickup (round trip by car), installation (1-2h assembly with manual), technical problem resolution, and return by carrier. They also generally limit prints (200-400 maximum) - imagine having to refuse prints to your guests at the end of the evening!
Our premium service includes: complete installation/uninstallation by us, REALLY unlimited prints (often 500+ photos per event), immediate technical support in case of trouble, exclusive technologies (Mirror with AI, 360° platform), and professional graphic customization.
The 200-300 CHF extra cost generally represents less than 3 CHF per guest to eliminate all stress and guarantee a perfect experience. It's the assurance that at the slightest problem, it's our responsibility, not yours. On your event day, you have better things to do than play technician!
